section: i-on will maintain the operation of the Hosted Site continuously, twenty-four (24) hours per day, seven (7) days per week, including holidays, with the exception of reasonable hardware and software maintenance that must be performed on the Hosting Computer and/or the Hosted Site. i-on will use best efforts to schedule and perform such maintenance between the hours of 8pm and 8am Eastern Standard Time on weekdays, or during weekends.
explanation: The text is ambiguous about what constitutes "reasonable" maintenance. This leaves open the possibility for i-on to perform excessive or poorly timed maintenance that disrupts service, while still claiming they are meeting their obligations.

section: The Customer is responsible for paying the recurring monthly fees by the 5th day of each month. The Customer acknowledges that failure to pay such fees in a timely manner will result in the interruption or discontinuation of services for the Hosted Site.
explanation: While the contract states that services will be interrupted if fees are not paid in a timely manner, it doesn't explicitly state what actions i-on can take. This ambiguity could lead to disputes about the exact penalties for late payments, such as service suspension versus full termination, or additional fees.

section:
This Agreement shall automatically be renewed for one (1) or more one (1) month periods unless either the Customer or i-on gives notice to the other party of its intention not to renew the
4 Agreement, which notice must be given not less than fifteen (15) days before the end of the respective initial or renewal term.
explanation: The renewal periods are listed as 'one (1) or more one (1) month periods' which is ambiguous. This section needs to be clarified. It also states that Either party may terminate this Agreement without cause at any time effective upon thirty (30) days' written notice.
